author: geirm
msg: Log output change so it's easier to see where the restarts happen -
useful for things like log4j which append rathen that rewrite, like
we have logkit configured to do.

author: geirm
msg: The log class now has to values, logkit (as before) and now also
log4j.  You can now just put either in the classpath, and vel will
automatically use the first one it finds.

author: geirm
msg: Changed to support finding of either/or/any of the logging classes
specified. The deafault is to try logkit, then log4j, so whichever
Also does better notification and logging in case of problems, so
should be easier to work with.

author: geirm
msg: Simple log4j logger class does two things, and two things only :
1) Allows specification of an existing category through the
so you can setup a category to whatever setup you wish in your
app, and then make vel log to it.
2) If that isn't specified, will simply log to a file specified
by "runtime.log", which is a rolling file appender, 1 roll log, max
I think we should keep the available config parameters to this to 1,
the log file name, and force people who have more complicated logging
needs to setup a log4j category themselves, and just tell velocity to
